Recently we learned that creepy firms like Cambridge Analytica mine Big Data from websites such as Facebook, using “psychographic microtargeting”—Orwell would have considered the term extreme—to alter public opinion, spread falsehoods and influence elections.
Companies and governments amass enormous troves of information about our online and offline activities, so they can understand them better than we do.
Facebook itself seems increasingly creepy, grounded in lying to the public about what happens to the data it collects.
‘Big Data” is the Big Bad of our moment.
